header.title: The Scroll of Set - April 1999
header.category: Western Esotericism, Left-Hand Path, Temple of Set Occultism

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set presents a multifaceted view of Setian Left-Hand Path philosophy and practice, emphasizing individual self-creation (Xeper), the development of isolate intelligence through conscious magical work, and the strategic manipulation of subjective and objective reality for personal evolution. It highlights practical methodologies within various Setian Orders and individual magical endeavors, contrasting Setian principles with conventional spiritual approaches.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] Concerning Setian Culture and the Value of Games
structure_content.summary: This article explores the influence of games on the subjective universe (SU) and proposes the creation of 'Setian games' for initiation aid and refreshing thought patterns, advocating for conscious magic over unconscious sigil implantation, aligning with a Setian civilization's metaphysical depth.

This piece critiques the conventional concept of 'authenticity' in religion, particularly in Left-Hand Path traditions, emphasizing individual self-creation and freedom from dogma as central to the psychecentric nature of the Temple of Set. It highlights the importance of conscious judgment in personal actions.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] The Occult Institute of Technology: Order Statement
structure_content.summary: This detailed statement explains the OIT as an Order within the Temple of Set, rooted in 'techno-magic' and a resonant paradigm. It defines the three-fold process of Setian LHP experience (extension, retraction, synchronization) for self-transformation, aiming to develop isolate intelligence and promote a cause-and-effect understanding of reality.

This interview provides insights into the Setian initiatory journey through the I°, II°, and III° degrees, stressing individual effort, antinomianism, finding one's purpose, and adopting a 'non-human approach to initiation' within the Priesthood. It emphasizes constant self-evaluation and adaptation.

This section details a Temple-wide 'Essential Working' for Setians to strengthen a chosen Temple aspect, explains 'images' (heka) as creations from body, socialization, and the Black Flame, defines the Priesthood's role as 'servants' facilitating initiation, and outlines the Setian use of 'space' (personal, life space, symbolic loci, conclaves, pylon gates) for self-transformation.

structure_content.chapter_title: [12] Uncle Setnakt's Essential Guide to the Left Hand Path
structure_content.summary: This book announcement outlines key topics fundamental to the Left-Hand Path, including its nature and goals, sovereignty, stages of initiation, the self and cosmos, magical principles, the grand initiation, and the Temple of Set's unique perspective on these concepts.

This article addresses the transition from Right-Hand Path to Left-Hand Path paradigms, focusing on achieving 'isolate awareness' by consciously positioning one's witnessing consciousness. It references Shiva symbology as representing Dark Perfection and a means to break conventional spiritual frameworks.

structure_content.chapter_title: [14] The Mind, Matter, and the Psychosphere
structure_content.summary: This piece defines the 'psychosphere' as the internal environment of the psyche and 'psychomancy' as the art of causing psychonomic change. It explains how the magician's 'I' interacts with mind-body and external matter through two proposed laws of the psychosphere, facilitating self-change (Xeper) and influencing chance.

structure_content.chapter_title: [17] A Commentary and Working from Project Neteru
structure_content.summary: This section presents a Greater Black Magic working designed to understand one's hidden Vampyric nature using two mirrors—one as a portal to the subjective, the other as a canvas for new reality. It aims for self-transcendence and objective change, drawing upon mythological themes of Vampyres and reflections.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian principle of self-creation and becoming, an active, conscious process of evolving beyond one's current state into a desired future self.

The First Principle of self-consciousness; the individual's inherent, unique identity and potential for self-directed evolution, distinct from the objective universe, emphasized by OIT and fundamental to the Temple of Set.

The essential mechanical principle underpinning all human perception and the OIT's paradigm for understanding the universe. It describes the extension and retraction of energy (ideas, becomings, affinities) that Initiates can learn to manipulate to create desired effects.
The internal environment of the psyche, also known as the 'world of the mind,' where psychomantic workings are enacted. It is the seat of the 'I' and a realm for direct magical influence.

The science or art of causing psychonomic change in conformity with one's will. This operative practice utilizes the psychosphere to affect both the mind-body and external matter, leading to personal transformation (Xeper).

A principle of setting oneself apart from conventional social matrices and norms, fostering independent thought and decision-making as a path to true freedom and self-discovery in the initiatory journey.

An ancient Egyptian term for 'servant,' reinterpreted in a Setian context as an Initiate who enforces their link with Set and aids others' initiation. This role, far from being subservient, facilitates deep personal change and the acquisition of non-human abilities.

The hidden, transformative nature within the magician, which can be explored and awakened through specific rituals (like the Rite of Two Mirrors) to achieve a higher state of being and influence objective reality.

The intrinsic divine spark or unique essence within each individual, central to Setian initiation and self-realization. It is understood as the source of non-natural consciousness and is utilized in magical workings.

practical_system.description: The overarching practical system outlined in the Scroll is the Temple of Set's Left-Hand Path initiation, centered on individual Xeper (self-creation) and the cultivation of Isolate Intelligence. This involves conscious magical work to affect subjective and objective reality, often through 'techno-magic,' psychomancy, and structured ritual. Practices are frequently self-designed or adapted from frameworks provided by various Setian Orders, aiming for profound personal transformation, the manifestation of individual will, and the deliberate extension of consciousness.
tools: Ritual Chamber: A dedicated, often dark and bare, space (or improvised area like a tent-like structure or closet) designed to minimize external stimuli and aid deep focus for magical workings.
Black Flame: Symbolically ignited (e.g., Sterno) during rituals as a focal point representing the essence of Set and the individual's Black Flame.
Mirrors: Used in specific workings (e.g., Rite of Two Mirrors) as portals to the subjective dimension and as canvases for manifesting new realities or self-perception.
Symbolic Objects: Minimal, focused items used within ritual chambers to enhance concentration and intent.
Altar Bell: Used to mark the precise beginning and end of magical workings (e.g., ringing 9x).
Typhonian Ink/Red Ink: Utilized for drawing symbols representing revelations or magical creations.
Personal Sigils/Symbols: Created by Initiates to encapsulate contact with neters or specific magical goals, used for future recall and manifestation.
Internet/Email/World Wide Web Access: Essential for OIT affiliation, communication, and access to secured online resources like journals, chat meetings, and lectures.
Reading Lists: Curated lists of books specified by Orders (e.g., OIT) for participants to obtain and study as part of their initiatory education.
Robe and Medallion: Worn during formal conclaves and gatherings, and potentially for personal ritual work, signifying one's degree and affiliation.
rituals: Essential Working (Temple-wide): A personal working performed annually on/near June 21st to strengthen a chosen 'essential property' of the Temple, with a subsequent report to another Setian.

Psychomantic Workings: Conscious use of the psychosphere to induce psychonomic change, affecting mind-body and external reality, leading to Xeper. Involves focusing on the 'I' to generate self-awareness for effective working.

Rite of Two Mirrors (Vampyric Essence): A Greater Black Magic working to understand one's hidden Vampyric nature. Involves two mirrors (one as a 'portal' to the subjective, one as a 'canvas' for new reality), a black candle, invocation to a chosen Vampyre (e.g., Lilith), and creating a symbol to manifest a new, stronger being for self-transcendence and objective change.

Pylon/Gathering Workings: Collaborative magical workings conducted at local (gatherings) and international (conclaves) meetings to foster deeper Setian activity, meet Priesthood, and develop regional projects.
Setian Games: Proposed cultural practices designed to aid initiation and refresh thought patterns, intended for conscious magical aim rather than unconscious sigil implantation.

relevant_quotes.text: Keep magic something special in your life; consider it a sacrament and a testament to the eternal majesty of your soul. Then you will find that it will dignify and sanctify your being, and will raise you above profane humanity.

As a Setian I intend to take full advantage of the great latitude given to me in determining my individual Xeper. Not having the burden of an authentic tradition thrust upon me was a great motivation to take these first few steps in my personal evolution.

The psychosphere is defined as the internal environment of the psyche - the world of the psyche or the world of the mind. Psychomancy is the science or art of causing psychonomic change to occur in conformity with will.
The III° is an exchange of some of your human freedom for some non-human freedom and ability. For this to be successful or even meaningful, the need for this must be innate.

'A Vampyre if caught between two mirrors will die'. I believe that this myth has a little basis in truth. I see it as a Vampyre 'caught' between two mirrors transcending to a higher state that the common man would probably view as a death.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Scroll of Set - April 1999 offers a direct, primary source insight into the diverse philosophical and practical currents within the Temple of Set during that period. It showcases both foundational Setian principles like Xeper and isolate intelligence, alongside specific methodologies of various Setian Orders and individual Initiates. The emphasis on self-creation, conscious magical practice, and the psychological dimensions of initiation is highly relevant to contemporary Left-Hand Path studies, providing an authentic perspective on an organized occult tradition that prioritizes individual sovereignty and evolving consciousness over rigid dogma.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Setian Initiates across all degrees (I°, II°, III°, IV°), particularly those engaged in deepening their philosophical understanding, exploring practical magic within their Orders (e.g., OIT, Order of Amon, Order of the Trapezoid), and pursuing personal development within the LHP framework. It also serves as an invaluable informational resource for individuals exploring the Temple of Set or Western Esotericism more broadly, offering a unique glimpse into the internal discourse, practices, and evolving theoretical frameworks of the organization.
